page.title: 11Post Office Sutton-cum-Lound
page.content: The post mistress gets up at half past five during the week. She opens the post office and shop at quarter past eight, except on Saturdays when opening time is nine o'clock and she closes at one o'clock on Wednesdays and Saturdays and half past five on other days. The post man comes from Doncaster every day except Sunday to deliver and collect the mail. The post woman sorts the letters and parcels and then delivers them in the village on her bicycle. The shop sells sweets, drinks, magazines, cards, books and general goods. Her best selling items are newspapers. Other popular items are cans of lemonade and blocks of chocolate. The busiest day in the post office is Thursday when people come in to collect their pensions
